intro: Barleria argentea, commonly known as silver barleria, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a perennial shrub that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters. The plant features opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are covered in a fine, silvery-white down, giving it its common name. Its flowers are small, tubular, and usually pink or purple, arranged in dense clusters. Barleria argentea is often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive foliage and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
